meanings.sent1: Leaves oxidate when exposed to air.
meanings.sent2: Metals can oxidate when left in a damp environment.
meanings.sent3: I forgot to close the lid, and now my food will oxidate in the fridge.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him seemed to oxidate slowly over time.
meanings.sent5: The fire's flames danced as they helped the wood oxidate into ash.

meanings.sent1: Apples oxidate and turn brown when sliced.

meanings.sent3: The old car began to oxidate, giving it a vintage look.
meanings.sent4: His patience started to oxidate as he waited in line.
meanings.sent5: The metal gate started to oxidate, creating a rusty appearance.

meanings.definition: To cause to combine with oxygen
meanings.sent1: The scientist will oxidate the compound to study its properties.
meanings.sent2: The process will oxidate the metal, making it more resistant to corrosion.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally oxidated the solution, causing an unexpected reaction.
meanings.sent4: The chef will oxidate the ingredients to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent5: The artist will oxidate the paint to create a unique texture on the canvas.
